subject: Travel
title: Dwarka: India's Underwater City
description: A fast breakdown of Dwarka: India's Underwater City for builders.

hook.text: Hindu scriptures describe a golden city that sank into the sea. Divers found ancient ruins exactly where the texts said.

buildup.text: Dwarka is described in the Mahabharata as the kingdom of Lord Krishna, submerged by rising seas.

discovery.text: In 2000, sonar revealed stone structures, pottery, and anchors 130 feet below the surface off Gujarat, India.

twist.text: The ruins date to roughly 1500 BC, aligning with the period described in the ancient texts.

climax.text: It's one of the rare cases where mythology and archaeology overlap. The story may have a real foundation.

punchline.text: A mythical sunken city turned out to be real.

quiz.question: Where were the underwater ruins of Dwarka found?
options: Off the coast of Gujarat, India
